m_szDocTitle: Industrial gas giant Air Liquide to build 12 hydrogen fuel stations in northeast U.S. - Canadian Manufacturing
m_szDocSumamry: Industrial gas giant Air Liquide to build 12 hydrogen fuel stations in northeast U.S. In partnership with Toyota, the fuel stations aim to support the widespread roll-out of fuel cell vehicles April 8, 2016 April 8, 2016 by Cleantech Canada Staff The infrastructure is designed to support the introduction of mass-market FCVs, such as the Toyota Mirai, seen here on the production line at the fuel cell stack installation stage. PHOTO: Toyota HOUSTON—French industrial gas company Air Liquide is looking to get into the U.S. hydrogen economy on the ground floor. The multinational firm’s American arm
